title: 史記
source: Chinese Text Project (ctext.org) - James Legge translation

passages.zh: 黃帝者，少典之子，姓公孫，名曰軒轅。
passages.en: Huangdi (Yellow emperor) was the son of Shaodian. His surname was Gongsun, and his prename Xuanyuan.

passages.zh: 生而神靈，弱而能言，幼而徇齊，長而敦敏，成而聰明。
passages.en: Born a genius he could speak when a baby, as a boy he was quick and smart, as a youth simple and earnest, and when grown up intelligent.

passages.zh: 軒轅之時，神農氏世衰。
passages.en: In the time of Xuanyuan, Shennong became enfeebled.

passages.zh: 諸侯相侵伐，暴虐百姓，而神農氏弗能征。
passages.en: The princes made raids on each other and harassed the people, but Shennong could not chastise them.

passages.zh: 於是軒轅乃習用干戈，以征不享，諸侯咸來賓從。
passages.en: So Xuanyuan exercised himself in the use of weapons of war, so as to be able to punish irregularities. The princes all came and did homage.

passages.zh: 而蚩尤最為暴，莫能伐。
passages.en: But Chiyou, the fiercest of all, could not be subdued.

passages.zh: 炎帝欲侵陵諸侯，諸侯咸歸軒轅。
passages.en: Yandi (Flame emperor) wished to oppress the princes, so they turned to Xuanyuan.

passages.zh: 軒轅乃修德振兵，治五氣，藝五種，撫萬民，度四方，教熊羆貔貅貙虎，以與炎帝戰於阪泉之野。
passages.en: Xuanyuan practised virtue, marshalled his men, controlled the five elements, cultivated the five kinds of grain, pacified the nations, and went over all parts of his country. Training black bears, grizzly bears, foxes, panthers, lynxes, and tigers, he, with their aid, fought with 'Flame emperor' in the desert of Banquan.

passages.zh: 三戰然後得其志。
passages.en: After three battles, he realised his wishes.

passages.zh: 蚩尤作亂，不用帝命。
passages.en: Chiyou was a rebel, who did not obey the Emperor's command.

passages.zh: 於是黃帝乃徵師諸侯，與蚩尤戰於涿鹿之野，遂禽殺蚩尤。
passages.en: So Huangdi, levying an army of the princes, fought against Chiyou, captured, and slew him in the desert of Zhuolu.

passages.zh: 而諸侯咸尊軒轅為天子，代神農氏，是為黃帝。
passages.en: The princes all agreed that Xuanyuan should be the Emperor in place of Shennong, under the title Huangdi.

passages.zh: 天下有不順者，黃帝從而征之，平者去之，披山通道，未嘗寧居。
passages.en: Those in the empire who would not submit, Huangdi pursued and chastised, and when they were subdued he left them. He made cuttings in hills, opened roads, and was never at rest.

passages.zh: 東至于海，登丸山，及岱宗。
passages.en: Eastward his empire extended to the sea, Ball hill, and the ancestral Dai mountain.

passages.zh: 西至于空桐，登雞頭。
passages.en: Westward to 'Hollow cave' and Cock's-head hills.

passages.zh: 南至于江，登熊、湘。
passages.en: Southward to the Yangtze river and Xiongxiang hill.

passages.zh: 北逐葷粥，合符釜山，而邑于涿鹿之阿。
passages.en: While in the north he drove out the Xunyu. He made a treaty on Kettle hill, and built a city on the slopes of Zhuolu.

passages.zh: 遷徙往來無常處，以師兵為營衛。
passages.en: He was constantly changing his residence, while his troops formed an encampment about him.

passages.zh: 官名皆以雲命，為雲師。
passages.en: He ordered his officers to be named after cloud omens.

passages.zh: 置左右大監，監于萬國。
passages.en: He appointed a chief and deputy superintendent over international affairs.

passages.zh: 萬國和，而鬼神山川封禪與為多焉。
passages.en: The various states being at peace, he worshipped the demons and spirits of the hills and streams with the feng and shan ceremonies in numbers.

passages.zh: 獲寶鼎，迎日推筴。
passages.en: He obtained a valuable tripod, and made calculations of future events.

passages.zh: 舉風后、力牧、常先、大鴻以治民。
passages.en: He appointed 'Chief of the winds,' 'Strength-governor,' 'Everfirst,' and 'Great Swan,' to direct the people.

passages.zh: 順天地之紀，幽明之占，死生之說，存亡之難。
passages.en: They acted in accordance with the celestial and terrestrial arrangements, the dark and bright prognostications, the disputations on life and death.

passages.zh: 時播百穀草木，淳化鳥獸蟲蛾，旁羅日月星辰水波土石金玉，勞勤心力耳目，節用水火材物。
passages.en: He planted the crops, plants, and trees in their seasons, and recorded the transformations of birds, beasts, insects, and moths. He also prepared a record of the movements of the sun, moon, and stars; the flow of the tides; and the properties of clay, stones, metals, and gems. He devoted much careful attention to these things, and his observation was applied to ascertaining how fire, water, wood, and other elements could be used economically.

passages.zh: 有土德之瑞，故號黃帝。
passages.en: There was an auspicious omen of the earth's energy, and he was therefore called 'Yellow god.'

passages.zh: 黃帝二十五子，其得姓者十四人。
passages.en: Huangdi had twenty-five sons, of whom fourteen received surnames.

passages.zh: 黃帝居于軒轅之丘，而娶于西陵之女，是為嫘祖為黃帝正妃，生二子，其後皆有天下。
passages.en: Huangdi lived at Xuanyuan hill, and married a woman of 'Western range' land called Leizu, who was his principal wife, and bore him two sons, both of whose descendants held Imperial sway.

passages.zh: 其一曰玄囂，是為青陽，青陽降居江水；其二曰昌意，降居若水。
passages.en: The eldest, named Xuanxiao, or Qingyang, dwelt on the Jiang stream, and the other, who was named Changyi, dwelt on the Ruo stream.

passages.zh: 昌意娶蜀山氏女，曰昌仆，生高陽，高陽有聖德焉。
passages.en: Changyi married a woman from the Shu hills (Sichuan) named Changpu, who bore him a son, Gaoyang, who possessed the virtue of a sage.

passages.zh: 黃帝崩，葬橋山。
passages.en: Huangdi died, and was buried at Qiaoshan.

passages.zh: 其孫昌意之子高陽立，是為帝顓頊也。
passages.en: His grandson, Changyi's son Gaoyang, came to the throne under the title Emperor Zhuanxu.

passages.zh: 帝顓頊高陽者，黃帝之孫而昌意之子也。
passages.en: Emperor Zhuanxu, or Gaoyang, was Huangdi's grandson and Changyi's son.

passages.zh: 靜淵以有謀，疏通而知事；養材以任地，載時以象天，依鬼神以制義，治氣以教化，絜誠以祭祀。
passages.en: Calm and unfathomable in his designs, and thoroughly versed in all matters, he exercised his talents in cultivating the ground; he recorded in their seasons the movements of the heavenly bodies, relied on spiritual influences in framing laws, taught reform by controlling the passion nature, and sacrificed with purity and sincerity.

passages.zh: 北至于幽陵，南至于交阯，西至于流沙，東至于蟠木。
passages.en: Northward his rule extended to 'Dark mound,' southward to Annam, westward to the moving sands, and eastward to 'Coiling tree'.

passages.zh: 動靜之物，大小之神，日月所照，莫不砥屬。
passages.en: Of animate and inanimate things, of spirits great and small, of those on whom the sun and moon shone, all were equally subject to him.

passages.zh: 帝顓頊生子曰窮蟬。
passages.en: Emperor Zhuanxu had a son, Qiongchan.

passages.zh: 顓頊崩，而玄囂之孫高辛立，是為帝嚳。
passages.en: Zhuanxu died, and Xuanxiao's grandson Gaoxin came to the throne under the title of Emperor Ku.

passages.zh: 帝嚳高辛者，黃帝之曾孫也。
passages.en: Emperor Ku, or Gaoxin was Huangdi's great grandson.

passages.zh: 高辛父曰蟜極，蟜極父曰玄囂，玄囂父曰黃帝。
passages.en: His father was Jiaoji, whose father was Xuanxiao, whose father was Huangdi.

passages.zh: 自玄囂與蟜極皆不得在位，至高辛即帝位。
passages.en: Neither Xuanxiao, nor Jiaoji came to the throne, but Gaoxin did hold Imperial sway.

passages.zh: 高辛於顓頊為族子。
passages.en: Gaoxin was a clansman of Zhuanxu.

passages.zh: 高辛生而神靈，自言其名。
passages.en: Being born a genius Gaoxin spoke from babyhood.

passages.zh: 普施利物，不於其身。
passages.en: He distributed his benefits everywhere, regardless of self.

passages.zh: 聰以知遠，明以察微。
passages.en: Intelligent enough to understand things far off, and clever enough to search into minutiae.

passages.zh: 順天之義，知民之急。
passages.en: He followed Heaven's laws, and knew the people's needs.

passages.zh: 仁而威，惠而信，修身而天下服。
passages.en: Humane yet dignified, kind yet truthful; he practised self-culture and all men submitted to him.

passages.zh: 取地之財而節用之，撫教萬民而利誨之，歷日月而迎送之，明鬼神而敬事之。
passages.en: He secured the revenue of the land, and spent it economically. He governed and instructed all his subjects, and they profited by the instruction. He made a calendar of the days and months past as well as future. He knew all about spirits, and worshipped them respectfully.

passages.zh: 其色郁郁，其德嶷嶷。
passages.en: His appearance was elegant, and his virtue eminent.

passages.zh: 其動也時，其服也士。
passages.en: His movements were well-timed, and his dress gentlemanly.

passages.zh: 帝嚳溉執中而遍天下，日月所照，風雨所至，莫不從服。
passages.en: Emperor Ku was thoroughly impartial all over his empire. There was no one on whom the sun and moon shone, or on whom the rain and wind blew, who was not devoted to him.

passages.zh: 帝嚳娶陳鋒氏女，生放勛。
passages.en: Emperor Ku married a daughter of Chenfeng, who bore a son named Fangxun ('The highly meritorious').

passages.zh: 娶娵訾氏女，生摯。
passages.en: He also married a daughter of Juzi, who bore a son Zhi.

passages.zh: 帝嚳崩，而摯代立。
passages.en: Emperor Ku died, and Zhi reigned in his stead.

passages.zh: 帝摯立，不善（崩），而弟放勛立，是為帝堯。
passages.en: Zhi reigned badly and died, and his brother 'The highly meritorious one' reigned under the title of Emperor Yao.

passages.zh: 帝堯者，放勛。
passages.en: Emperor Yao was highly meritorious.

passages.zh: 其仁如天，其知如神。
passages.en: His benevolence was like that of heaven, and his wisdom that of a god.

passages.zh: 就之如日，望之如雲。
passages.en: When approached he was genial as the sun, and was looked out for as clouds in dry weather.

passages.zh: 富而不驕，貴而不舒。
passages.en: He was rich without being proud, and esteemed yet not lax.

passages.zh: 黃收純衣，彤車乘白馬。
passages.en: He wore a yellow hat and plain silk dress, and drove a red car drawn by white horses.

passages.zh: 能明馴德，以親九族。
passages.en: He was able to display his supereminent virtue, by bringing into close alliance the nine degrees of kindred.

passages.zh: 九族既睦，便章百姓。
passages.en: They being rendered harmonious, he forthwith regulated the people.

passages.zh: 百姓昭明，合和萬國。
passages.en: His people having become enlightened, the various states were at peace.

passages.zh: 乃命羲、和，敬順昊天，數法日月星辰，敬授民時。
passages.en: He then commanded Xi and He in reverent accordance with their observations of the wide heavens to record in a calendar the laws affecting the sun, moon, stars, and zodiacal spaces, and respectfully to communicate to the people the seasons adapted for labour.

passages.zh: 分命羲仲，居郁夷，曰暘谷。
passages.en: He also commanded Xi's younger brother to reside at Yuyi, called the bright valley.

passages.zh: 敬道日出，便程東作。
passages.en: He was to hail with respect the rising sun, and arrange the labours of the spring.

passages.zh: 日中，星鳥，以殷中春。
passages.en: The day being of medium length, and the culminating star the central one of the 'Bird' quarter of the heavens, he was to determine midspring.

passages.zh: 其民析，鳥獸字微。
passages.en: When the people begin to disperse, and birds and beasts to breed and copulate.

passages.zh: 申命羲叔，居南交。
passages.en: He further commanded Xi's third brother to reside at the southern frontier.

passages.zh: 便程南為，敬致。
passages.en: He was to arrange the transformations of summer, and respectfully observe the extreme limit of the shadow.

passages.zh: 日永，星火，以正中夏。
passages.en: The day being at its longest, and the star in the zenith that called 'Fire,' he was to fix the exact period of midsummer.

passages.zh: 其民因，鳥獸希革。
passages.en: When the people are most widely dispersed, birds moult, and beasts change their coats.

passages.zh: 申命和仲，居西土，曰昧谷。
passages.en: He further commanded He's younger brother to reside in the west at a place called Dark Valley.

passages.zh: 敬道日入，便程西成。
passages.en: He was to respectfully convoy the setting sun, and arrange the completing labours of the autumn.

passages.zh: 夜中，星虛，以正中秋。
passages.en: The night being of medium length, and the culminating star Xu, he was to determine mid-autumn.

passages.zh: 其民夷易，鳥獸毛毨。
passages.en: When people begin to feel comfortable, and birds and beasts look smooth and glossy.

passages.zh: 申命和叔；居北方，曰幽都。
passages.en: He further commanded He's third brother to reside in the northern region in what was called the sombre capital.

passages.zh: 便在伏物。
passages.en: He was to examine the hidden things.

passages.zh: 日短，星昴，以正中冬。
passages.en: The day being at its shortest, and the culminating star Mao, he was to determine midwinter.

passages.zh: 其民燠，鳥獸氄毛。
passages.en: When people get into cosy corners, and the coats of birds and beasts are downy and thick.

passages.zh: 歲三百六十六日，以閏月正四時。
passages.en: The year consisted of 366 days, an intercalary month being added to adjust the four seasons.

passages.zh: 信飭百官，眾功皆興。
passages.en: Authentic directions were given to the various officers, and their several labours commenced.

passages.zh: 堯曰：「誰可順此事？」
passages.en: Yao said, 'Who can obediently manage these matters?'

passages.zh: 放齊曰：「嗣子丹朱開明。」
passages.en: Fangqi said, 'There is your adopted son Danzhu, who is developing his intelligence.'

passages.zh: 堯曰：「吁！頑凶，不用。」
passages.en: Yao said, 'Oh! he is unscrupulous and wicked; I cannot employ him.'

passages.zh: 堯又曰：「誰可者？」
passages.en: He said again, 'Who will do it?'

passages.zh: 讙兜曰：「共工旁聚布功，可用。」
passages.en: Huandou said, 'The minister of works, who is generally popular, and has displayed merit, could be employed.'

passages.zh: 堯曰：「共工善言，其用僻，似恭漫天，不可。」
passages.en: Yao said, 'The minister of works is talkative; if he is employed, his depravities, although he is apparently respectful, would overspread the heavens, he will not do.'

passages.zh: 堯又曰：「嗟，四嶽，湯湯洪水滔天，浩浩懷山襄陵，下民其憂，有能使治者？」
passages.en: He said further, 'Alas! O president of the four mountains, the waters of the flood rise up to heaven, and in their vast expanse encompass the mountains, and overtop the hills; the common people are troubled about it. Is there a capable man whom I could set to deal with the matter?'

passages.zh: 皆曰鯀可。
passages.en: They all said, 'Gun might do it.'

passages.zh: 堯曰：「鯀負命毀族，不可。」
passages.en: Yao said, 'Gun disobeys orders, and ruins his companions. He will not do.'

passages.zh: 嶽曰：「異哉，試不可用而已。」
passages.en: The President said, 'Ah! well! try him, and if he is found useless, have done with him.'

passages.zh: 堯於是聽嶽用鯀。
passages.en: Whereupon Yao adopting his suggestion, employed Gun.

passages.zh: 九歲，功用不成。
passages.en: For nine years his work was not completed.

passages.zh: 堯曰：「嗟！四嶽：朕在位七十載，汝能庸命，踐朕位？」
passages.en: Yao said, 'Alas! O president of the four mountains, I have been on the throne seventy years; you are able to carry out the decrees, do you occupy my throne.'

passages.zh: 嶽應曰：「鄙德忝帝位。」
passages.en: The president replied, 'My moral qualities are of such a low order that I should disgrace the Imperial throne.'

passages.zh: 堯曰：「悉舉貴戚及疏遠隱匿者。」
passages.en: Yao said, 'You must all recommend one of your esteemed relations, or even an obscure stranger.'

passages.zh: 眾皆言於堯曰：「有矜在民閒，曰虞舜。」
passages.en: All the courtiers said to Yao, 'There is an unmarried man of the lower orders called Shun of Yu.'

passages.zh: 堯曰：「然，朕聞之。其何如？」
passages.en: Yao said, 'Yes, I have heard of him, what is he like?'

passages.zh: 嶽曰：「盲者子。父頑，母嚚，弟傲，能和以孝，烝烝治，不至姦。」
passages.en: The president said, 'He is the son of a blind man; his father was unprincipled, his mother insincere, and his brother arrogant, but he managed by his dutiful conduct to be reconciled to them, so they have gradually improved, and not been extremely wicked.'

passages.zh: 堯曰：「吾其試哉。」
passages.en: 'Shall I try him?' said Yao.

passages.zh: 於是堯妻之二女，觀其德於二女。
passages.en: He then married his two daughters to Shun, and watched his behaviour towards them.

passages.zh: 舜飭下二女於媯汭，如婦禮。
passages.en: Shun sent the two women down to the north of the Gui river, and treated them with the ceremony due to them as his wives.

passages.zh: 堯善之，乃使舜慎和五典，五典能從。
passages.en: Yao praised Shun, and told him to carefully harmonize the five human relationships and when they could be obeyed.

passages.zh: 乃遍入百官，百官時序。
passages.en: These became universal among the various officials, who at the proper times arranged matters in order.

passages.zh: 賓於四門，四門穆穆，諸侯遠方賓客皆敬。
passages.en: The visitors at the four gates were submissive, the princes and strangers from distant regions became one and all respectful.

passages.zh: 堯使舜入山林川澤，暴風雷雨，舜行不迷。
passages.en: Yao sent Shun into the hills and forests among rivers and swamps, but although fierce winds and thunderstorms prevailed, Shun did not miss his way.

passages.zh: 堯以為聖，召舜曰：「女謀事至而言可績，三年矣。女登帝位。」
passages.en: Yao then taking Shun to be a holy man, called him and said, 'For three years your deliberations have been excellent, and I have found that your words can be carried into practice. You shall ascend the Imperial throne.'

passages.zh: 舜讓於德不懌。
passages.en: Shun yielded in favour of some one more virtuous than himself, and was unhappy.

passages.zh: 正月上日，舜受終於文祖。
passages.en: But on the first day of the first month Shun accepted Yao's resignation in the temple of the accomplished ancestor.

passages.zh: 文祖者，堯大祖也。
passages.en: The accomplished ancestor was Yao's great ancestor.

passages.zh: 於是帝堯老，命舜攝行天子之政，以觀天命。
passages.en: The Emperor Yao being old ordered that Shun should be associated with him in the government of the Empire in order to observe Heaven's decrees.

passages.zh: 舜乃在璿璣玉衡，以齊七政。
passages.en: Shun thereupon examined the gem-adorned armillary sphere, and the jade transverse, so as to adjust the position of the 'Seven Directors.'

passages.zh: 遂類于上帝，禋于六宗，望于山川，辯于群神。
passages.en: He then offered a special sacrifice to the Supreme Ruler, sacrificed purely to the six honoured ones, looked with devotion to the hills and rivers, and worshipped with distinctive rites the hosts of spirits.

passages.zh: 揖五瑞，擇吉月日，見四嶽諸牧，班瑞。
passages.en: He called in the five tokens, chose a lucky month and day, gave audience to the president of the four mountains, and all the governors, returning the tokens in due course.

passages.zh: 歲二月，東巡狩，至於岱宗，祡，望秩於山川。
passages.en: In the second month of every year he went eastward on a tour of inspection, and on reaching Daizong he presented a burnt-offering, and sacrificed in order to the hills and rivers.

passages.zh: 遂見東方君長，合時月正日，同律度量衡，修五禮五玉三帛二生一死為摯，如五器，卒乃復。
passages.en: He then gave audience to the chieftains of the East, putting in accord their seasons and months, and rectifying the days. He rendered uniform the standard tubes, the measures of length and capacity, and the scales; and regulated the five kinds of ceremonies. The five gems, the three kinds of silks, the two living animals, and one dead one were brought as presents to the audience, but the five implements were returned at the conclusion.

passages.zh: 五月，南巡狩；八月，西巡狩；十一月，北巡狩：皆如初。
passages.en: In the fifth month he went to the south, in the eighth month to the west, and in the eleventh month northward on his tours of inspection; in each case observing the same ceremonies as before.

passages.zh: 歸，至于祖禰廟，用特牛禮。
passages.en: On his return he went to the temple of the ancestral tablets, and offered up a single ox.

passages.zh: 五歲一巡狩，群后四朝。
passages.en: Every five years there was one tour of inspection, and four audiences of the princes at court.

passages.zh: 遍告以言，明試以功，車服以庸。
passages.en: When they presented a full verbal report, which was intelligently tested by their works, and chariots and robes given according to their deserts.

passages.zh: 肇十有二州，決川。
passages.en: Shun instituted the division of the Empire into twelve provinces, and deepened the rivers.

passages.zh: 象以典刑，流宥五刑，鞭作官刑，撲作教刑，金作贖刑。
passages.en: He gave delineations of the statutory punishments, enacting banishment as a mitigation of the five chief punishments, the whip being employed for public officers, the stick in schools, and a money penalty being inflicted for redeemable crimes.

passages.zh: 眚災過，赦；怙終賊，刑。
passages.en: Inadvertent offences, and those caused by misfortune were to be pardoned, and those who offended presumptuously or repeatedly were to be punished with death.

passages.zh: 欽哉，欽哉，惟刑之靜哉！
passages.en: 'Be reverent, be reverent,' said he, 'and in the administration of the law be tranquil.'

passages.zh: 讙兜進言共工，堯曰不可而試之工師，共工果淫辟。
passages.en: Huandou approached, and spoke about the minister of works. 'I cannot even give him a trial as a workman,' said Yao, 'for he is really profligate.'

passages.zh: 四嶽舉鯀治鴻水，堯以為不可，嶽彊請試之，試之而無功，故百姓不便。
passages.en: The president of the four mountains recommended Gun as the proper person to look after the deluge. Yao regarded it as impracticable, but the president vehemently requested that he might be tried, so the trial was made, but without good results.

passages.zh: 三苗在江淮、荊州數為亂。
passages.en: Of old the people had felt that it was undesirable that the three Miao tribes in the districts of Jiang Huai, and Jing should so often rise in rebellion.

passages.zh: 於是舜歸而言於帝，請流共工於幽陵，以變北狄；放讙兜於崇山，以變南蠻；遷三苗於三危，以變西戎；殛鯀於羽山，以變東夷：四罪而天下咸服。
passages.en: So Shun on his return spoke to the emperor requesting that the minister of works might be banished to the ridge of Yu to reform the Northern Ti tribes, that Huandou might be detained on mount Chong, to reform the Southern barbarians, that the chief of the three Miao tribes might be removed to Sanwei to reform the Western Rong people, and that Gun might be imprisoned for life on Mount Yu to reform the Eastern barbarians. These four criminals being thus dealt with, universal submission prevailed throughout the empire.

passages.zh: 堯立七十年得舜，二十年而老，令舜攝行天子之政，薦之於天。
passages.en: Yao had sat on the throne seventy years, when he secured Shun's services for twenty years; then, being old, he directed that Shun should be associated with him in the government of the empire, and presented him to Heaven.

passages.zh: 堯辟位凡二十八年而崩。
passages.en: Yao had abdicated the throne twenty-eight years when he died.

passages.zh: 百姓悲哀，如喪父母。
passages.en: The people mourned for him as for a parent.

passages.zh: 三年，四方莫舉樂，以思堯。
passages.en: No music being played for three years throughout the empire, for which reason he was remembered.

passages.zh: 堯知子丹朱之不肖，不足授天下，於是乃權授舜。
passages.en: Yao knew that his son Danzhu was a worthless fellow, who was not fit to reign, and so the authority was conferred on Shun.

passages.zh: 授舜，則天下得其利而丹朱病；授丹朱，則天下病而丹朱得其利。
passages.en: As it was conferred on Shun, the empire got the advantage and Danzhu was injured. If it had been conferred on Danzhu, the empire would have been injured, and Danzhu gained the advantage.

passages.zh: 堯曰：「終不以天下之病而利一人」，而卒授舜以天下。
passages.en: Yao said, 'We certainly cannot cause the empire to suffer loss, and the advantage go to an individual.' In the end the empire was given over to Shun.

passages.zh: 堯崩，三年之喪畢，舜讓辟丹朱於南河之南。
passages.en: After the death of Yao, when the three years' mourning was over, Shun gave way to Danzhu, and retired to the south of the southern river.

passages.zh: 諸侯朝覲者不之丹朱而之舜，獄訟者不之丹朱而之舜，謳歌者不謳歌丹朱而謳歌舜。
passages.en: When the princes went to an audience at court, they did not present themselves before Danzhu, but before Shun; litigants did not go before Danzhu, but Shun; and the singers did not sing in praise of Danzhu, but of Shun.

passages.zh: 舜曰：「天也」，夫而後之中國踐天子位焉，是為帝舜。
passages.en: Shun said, 'It is from Heaven.' Afterwards he went to the capital, sat on the Imperial throne, and was styled Emperor Shun.

passages.zh: 虞舜者，名曰重華。
passages.en: Shun of Yu was named Chonghua (double splendour).

passages.zh: 重華父曰瞽叟，瞽叟父曰橋牛，橋牛父曰句望，句望父曰敬康，敬康父曰窮蟬，窮蟬父曰帝顓頊，顓頊父曰昌意：以至舜七世矣。
passages.en: Chonghua's father was Gusou; Gusou's father was Qiaoniu; Qiaoniu's father was Juwang; Juwang's father was Jingkang; Jingkang's father was Qiongchan; Qiongchan's father was Emperor Zhuanxu; Zhuanxu's father was Changyi. From him to Shun we have seven generations.

passages.zh: 自從窮蟬以至帝舜，皆微為庶人。
passages.en: From Qiongchan to Emperor Shun they were all insignificant common people.

passages.zh: 舜父瞽叟盲，而舜母死，瞽叟更娶妻而生象，象傲。
passages.en: Shun's father, Gusou, was blind, and his mother having died, Gusou married again and had a son, Xiang, who was arrogant.

passages.zh: 瞽叟愛後妻子，常欲殺舜，舜避逃；及有小過，則受罪。
passages.en: Gusou loved his second wife, and frequently tried to kill Shun, who avoided him; when he made slight mistakes he was punished.

passages.zh: 順事父及後母與弟，日以篤謹，匪有解。
passages.en: Yet he obediently served his father, stepmother, and brother, and was day by day generous, careful, and never negligent.

passages.zh: 舜，冀州之人也。
passages.en: Shun was a native of Jizhou.

passages.zh: 舜耕歷山，漁雷澤，陶河濱，作什器於壽丘，就時於負夏。
passages.en: He ploughed on Li mountain, fished in Thunder lake, made pots on the bank of the river, fashioned various articles at Shouqiu, and went now and then to Fuxia.

passages.zh: 舜父瞽叟頑，母嚚，弟象傲，皆欲殺舜。
passages.en: Shun's father, Gusou, was unprincipled, his mother insincere, and his brother, Xiang, arrogant. They all tried to kill Shun.

passages.zh: 舜順適不失子道，兄弟孝慈。
passages.en: Shun was obedient, and never by chance failed in his duty as a son, or his fraternal love.

passages.zh: 欲殺，不可得；即求，嘗在側。
passages.en: Though they tried to kill him they did not succeed, and when they sought him he got out of the way.

passages.zh: 舜年二十以孝聞。
passages.en: When Shun was twenty years old he was noted for his filial piety.

passages.zh: 三十而帝堯問可用者，四嶽咸薦虞舜，曰可。
passages.en: When he was thirty the Emperor Yao asked if he was fit to reign. The presidents united in bringing Shun of Yu forward as an able man.

passages.zh: 於是堯乃以二女妻舜以觀其內，使九男與處以觀其外。
passages.en: So Yao gave him his two daughters in marriage in order to observe his conduct at home, and bade his nine sons put him in charge of a post so as to note his behaviour abroad.

passages.zh: 舜居媯汭，內行彌謹。
passages.en: Shun lived within the bend of the Kuei river, and was especially careful.

passages.zh: 堯二女不敢以貴驕事舜親戚，甚有婦道。
passages.en: Yao's two daughters did not dare, on account of their rank, to be proud, but waited on Shun's relations, and were constant in their wifely duties.

passages.zh: 堯九男皆益篤。
passages.en: Yao's nine sons became more and more generous.

passages.zh: 舜耕歷山，歷山之人皆讓畔；漁雷澤，雷澤上人皆讓居；陶河濱，河濱器皆不苦窳。
passages.en: When Shun ploughed on Li mountain, the inhabitants yielded the boundaries; when he fished in Thunder lake, the men on the lake yielded to him the best place; and when he made pots on the bank of the river, his vessels had no holes or flaws in them.

passages.zh: 一年而所居成聚，二年成邑，三年成都。
passages.en: If he dwelt in a place for a year he formed an assemblage, in two years it became a town, and in three a metropolis.

passages.zh: 堯乃賜舜絺衣，與琴，為筑倉廩，予牛羊。
passages.en: Yao gave Shun clothes made of fine grass-cloth, and a lute, and built him a granary and shed for his oxen and sheep.

passages.zh: 瞽叟尚復欲殺之，使舜上涂廩，瞽叟從下縱火焚廩。
passages.en: Gusou again tried to kill Shun by making him go up and plaster the roof of the granary, while he set fire to it from below.

passages.zh: 舜乃以兩笠自捍而下，去，得不死。
passages.en: But Shun, protecting himself from the fire with a couple of bamboo hats, came down and escaped with his life.

passages.zh: 後瞽叟又使舜穿井，舜穿井為匿空旁出。
passages.en: Gusou after this told Shun to dig a well, which he did, making a secret tunnel at the side to get out at.

passages.zh: 舜既入深，瞽叟與象共下土實井，舜從匿空出，去。
passages.en: When Shun had gone right in, Gusou and Xiang filled up the well with earth, but Shun came out by the secret passage.

passages.zh: 瞽叟、象喜，以舜為已死。
passages.en: Gusou and Xiang rejoiced, thinking that Shun was dead.

passages.zh: 象曰：「本謀者象。」
passages.en: Xiang said, 'The plot was mine.'

passages.zh: 象與其父母分，於是曰：「舜妻堯二女，與琴，象取之。牛羊倉廩予父母。」
passages.en: 'But I will go shares with my father and mother; I will take Shun's wives, Yao's two daughters, and the lute as my share, while the oxen, sheep, granary and shed shall belong to my parents.'

passages.zh: 象乃止舜宮居，鼓其琴。
passages.en: He remained, however, in Shun's house playing on the lute.

passages.zh: 舜往見之。
passages.en: When Shun went thither.

passages.zh: 象鄂不懌，曰：「我思舜正郁陶！」
passages.en: Xiang, startled and not well-pleased to see him, said, 'I was just thinking of you, and getting very anxious.'

passages.zh: 舜曰：「然，爾其庶矣！」
passages.en: 'Quite so,' said Shun, 'and so you possessed yourself of all these things.'

passages.zh: 舜復事瞽叟愛弟彌謹。
passages.en: Shun again served Gusou, loved his brother, and was still more careful in his conduct.

passages.zh: 於是堯乃試舜五典百官，皆治。
passages.en: Yao thereupon tested Shun as to the five cardinal rules, and the various officers were under control.

passages.zh: 昔高陽氏有才子八人，世得其利，謂之「八愷」。
passages.en: In former days the Emperor Gaoyang had eight talented sons; the world benefited by them, and they were called the eight benevolent ones.

passages.zh: 高辛氏有才子八人，世謂之「八元」。
passages.en: The Emperor Gaoxin had also eight talented sons, and men called them the eight virtuous ones.

passages.zh: 此十六族者，世濟其美，不隕其名。
passages.en: Of these sixteen men after ages have acknowledged the excellence, and not let their names fall to the ground.

passages.zh: 至於堯，堯未能舉。
passages.en: In the time of Yao he was not able to raise them to office.

passages.zh: 舜舉八愷，使主后土，以揆百事，莫不時序。
passages.en: But Shun raised the eight benevolent ones to office, and made them superintend the land department and direct all matters, arranging them according to their seasons.

passages.zh: 舉八元，使布五教于四方，父義，母慈，兄友，弟恭，子孝，內平外成。
passages.en: He also raised the eight virtuous ones to office, employing them to spread throughout the country a knowledge of the duties pertaining to the five social relationships, for fathers became just, mothers loving, elder brothers sociable, younger ones respectful, and children dutiful; within the empire there was peace, and beyond it submission.

passages.zh: 昔帝鴻氏有不才子，掩義隱賊，好行凶慝，天下謂之渾沌。
passages.en: In ancient days the Emperor Hong had a son devoid of ability, who shut himself off from duty, and was a villain in secret, delighting in the practice of the worst vices, and all men called him Hundun (Chaos).

passages.zh: 少暤氏有不才子，毀信惡忠，崇飾惡言，天下謂之窮奇。
passages.en: The Emperor Shaohao had a descendant devoid of ability, who overthrew good faith, hated loyalty, extolled specious and evil talk, and all the people called him Qiongqi (Monster).

passages.zh: 顓頊氏有不才子，不可教訓，不知話言，天下謂之梼杌。
passages.en: Zhuanxu had a son devoid of ability, who would receive no instruction and acknowledge no good words, and all the people called him Taowu (Block).

passages.zh: 此三族世憂之。
passages.en: These three men everyone was distressed about.

passages.zh: 至于堯，堯未能去。
passages.en: Until the time of Yao, but Yao could not send them away.

passages.zh: 縉云氏有不才子，貪于飲食，冒于貨賄，天下謂之饕餮。
passages.en: Jinyun had a son devoid of ability, who was greedy in eating and drinking, and pursued wealth blindly. All the people called him Taotie (Glutton).

passages.zh: 天下惡之，比之三凶。
passages.en: He was hated and compared to the three other wicked men.

passages.zh: 舜賓於四門，乃流四凶族，遷于四裔，以御螭魅，於是四門辟，言毋凶人也。
passages.en: Shun received visitors at the four gates, but banished these four wicked ones to the four borders of the empire to manage hobgoblins; and those at the four gates rightly said there were no wicked men among them.

passages.zh: 舜入于大麓，烈風雷雨不迷，堯乃知舜之足授天下。
passages.en: Shun went to the great plains at the foot of the mountains, and, amid violent wind, thunder, and rain, did not go astray. Yao then knew that Shun was fit to accept the empire.

passages.zh: 堯老，使舜攝行天子政，巡狩。
passages.en: Being old, Yao caused Shun to be associated with him in the government, and when he went on a tour of inspection.

passages.zh: 舜得舉用事二十年，而堯使攝政。
passages.en: Shun was promoted and employed in the administration of affairs for twenty years; and Yao having directed that he should be associated in the government.

passages.zh: 攝政八年而堯崩。
passages.en: He was so associated for eight years. Yao died.

passages.zh: 三年喪畢，讓丹朱，天下歸舜。
passages.en: When the three years' mourning was over, Shun yielded to Danzhu, but the people of the empire turned to Shun.

passages.zh: 而禹、皋陶、契、后稷、伯夷、夔、龍、倕、益、彭祖自堯時而皆舉用，未有分職。
passages.en: Now Yu, Gaoyao, Xie, Houji, Boyi, Kui, Long, Chui Yi, and Pengzu were all from the time of Yao promoted to office, but had not separate appointments.

passages.zh: 於是舜乃至於文祖，謀于四嶽，辟四門，明通四方耳目，命十二牧論帝德，行厚德，遠佞人，則蠻夷率服。
passages.en: Shun having then proceeded to the temple of the accomplished ancestor, deliberated with the president of the four mountains, threw open the four gates, and was in direct communication with officers in all four quarters of the empire, who were eyes and ears to him. He ordered the twelve governors to talk of the Emperor's virtue, to be kind to the virtuous, and keep the artful at a distance, so that the barbarians of the south might lead on one another to be submissive.

passages.zh: 舜謂四嶽曰：「有能奮庸美堯之事者，使居官相事？」
passages.en: He said to the president of the four mountains, 'Is there anyone who can vigorously display his merits, and beautify Yao's undertakings, and whom I can make prime minister?'

passages.zh: 皆曰：「伯禹為司空，可美帝功。」
passages.en: They all said, 'There is Baron Yu, the superintendent of works, he can beautify the Emperor's labours.'

passages.zh: 舜曰：「嗟，然！禹，汝平水土，維是勉哉。」
passages.en: Shun said, 'Ah! yes, Yu, you have put in order the water and the land, but in this matter you must exert yourself.'

passages.zh: 禹拜稽首，讓於稷、契與皋陶。
passages.en: Yu did obeisance with his head to the ground, while declining in favour of Hou Ji, Xie, or Gaoyao.

passages.zh: 舜曰：「然，往矣。」
passages.en: Shun said, 'Yes; but do you go and set about it.'

passages.zh: 舜曰：「棄，黎民始饑，汝后稷播時百穀。」
passages.en: Shun said, 'Qi, the black-haired people begin to be famished. Do you, Prince Millet, sow in their seasons the various kinds of grain.'

passages.zh: 舜曰：「契，百姓不親，五品不馴，汝為司徒，而敬敷五教，在寬。」
passages.en: He also said, 'Xie, the people do not love one another, and the five orders of relationship are not observed. You, as minister of instruction, must carefully diffuse abroad those five lessons of duty, but do so with gentleness.'

passages.zh: 舜曰：「皋陶，蠻夷猾夏，寇賊姦軌，汝作士，五刑有服，五服三就；五流有度，五度三居：維明能信。」
passages.en: He also said, 'Gaoyao, the southern barbarians are disturbing the summer region, while robbers, murderers, villains, and traitors abound. Do you, as minister of crime, exercise repression by use of the five kinds of punishment—for the infliction of which there are three appointed places—and the five banishments with their several places of detention, and the three degrees of distance. Be intelligent and you will inspire confidence.'

passages.zh: 舜曰：「誰能馴予工？」皆曰垂可。於是以垂為共工。
passages.en: Shun said, 'Who can direct the workmen?' They all said 'Chui can do it'; so he made Chui minister of works.

passages.zh: 舜曰：「誰能馴予上下草木鳥獸？」皆曰益可。於是以益為朕虞。
passages.en: Shun said, 'Who can superintend my uplands and lowlands, pastures and woods, birds and beasts?' They all said, 'Yi is the man'; so Yi was made imperial forester.

passages.zh: 益拜稽首，讓于諸臣朱虎、熊羆。
passages.en: Yi did obeisance with his head to the ground, and declined in favour of the officials Fir, Tiger, Black Bear, and Grizzly Bear.

passages.zh: 舜曰：「往矣，汝諧。」遂以朱虎、熊羆為佐。
passages.en: Shun said, 'Go and act harmoniously.' Fir, Tiger, Black Bear, and Grizzly Bear were accordingly his assistants.

passages.zh: 舜曰：「嗟！四嶽，有能典朕三禮？」皆曰伯夷可。
passages.en: Shun said, 'Ah! president of the four mountains, is there anyone who can superintend the three ceremonies?' They all said, 'Baron Yi is the man.'

passages.zh: 舜曰：「嗟！伯夷，以汝為秩宗，夙夜維敬，直哉維靜絜。」
passages.en: Shun said, 'Ah! Baron Yi, I will make you arranger of the ancestral temple. Day and night be careful, be upright, be pure.'

passages.zh: 伯夷讓夔、龍。
passages.en: Baron Yi declined in favour of Kui or Long.

passages.zh: 舜曰：「然。以夔為典樂，教稚子，直而溫，寬而栗，剛而毋虐，簡而毋傲；詩言意，歌長言，聲依永，律和聲，八音能諧，毋相奪倫，神人以和。」
passages.en: But Shun said, 'Let it be so,' and made Kui director of music and teacher of youth. 'Be straightforward,' he added, 'and yet mild; lenient and yet stern; firm, yet not tyrannical; impetuous, yet not arrogant. Poetry gives expression to the thought, and singing is the prolonged utterance of that expression. Notes accompany that utterance, and are harmonized themselves by the pitch-pipes. The eight kinds of instruments can be adjusted, so that one shall not take from or interfere with another, and spirits and men are thereby brought into harmony.'

passages.zh: 夔曰：「於！予擊石拊石，百獸率舞。」
passages.en: Kui said, 'Oh! I smite the stone; I tap the stone, and the various animals lead on one another to dance.'

passages.zh: 舜曰：「龍，朕畏忌讒說殄偽，振驚朕眾，命汝為納言，夙夜出入朕命，惟信。」
passages.en: Shun said, 'Long, I dread slanderous speakers and injurious deceivers, who agitate and alarm my people. I appoint you minister of communication. Day and night you will issue and receive my orders, but be truthful.'

passages.zh: 舜曰：「嗟！女二十有二人，敬哉，惟時相天事。」
passages.en: Shun said, 'Ah! you twenty and two men, be reverent, and you will aid in their proper seasons the undertakings of heaven.'

passages.zh: 三歲一考功，三考絀陟，遠近眾功咸興。
passages.en: Every three years there was an examination of merits, and after three examinations there were degradations and promotions both far and near. The people's labours generally prospered.

passages.zh: 分北三苗。
passages.en: While the people of the three Miao tribes were divided and defeated.

passages.zh: 此二十二人咸成厥功：皋陶為大理，平，民各伏得其實；伯夷主禮，上下咸讓；垂主工師，百工致功；益主虞，山澤辟；棄主稷，百穀時茂；契主司徒，百姓親和；龍主賓客，遠人至；十二牧行而九州莫敢辟違。
passages.en: These twenty-two all completed their labours. Gaoyao was chief minister of crime, and the people were all subservient and obtained his genuine services. Boyi was director of ceremonies, and both upper and lower classes were retiring. Chui was head workman, and the various kinds of work were successfully accomplished. Yi was head forester, and hills and swamps were brought under cultivation. Qi was director of agriculture, and the various crops ripened in their seasons. Xie was minister of instruction, and the people were friendly together. Long superintended the foreign department, and men from afar arrived. The twelve governors did their duty, and the people of the nine provinces did not dare to rebel.

passages.zh: 唯禹之功為大，披九山，通九澤，決九河，定九州，各以其職來貢，不失厥宜。
passages.en: But Yu's labours consisted in making great cuttings through the nine hills, making thoroughfares through the nine swamps, deepening the nine rivers, and regulating the nine provinces, each of which by their officials sent tribute, and did not lose their rightful dues.

passages.zh: 方五千里，至于荒服。
passages.en: In a square of 5000 li he reached the wild domain.

passages.zh: 南撫交阯、北發，西戎、析枝、渠廋、氐、羌，北山戎、發、息慎，東長、鳥夷，四海之內咸戴帝舜之功。
passages.en: To the south he governed Annam; on the north he reduced the western Rong tribes, Xizhi, Chusou, and the Qiang of Di; on the north the hill Rong tribes and the Xishen; and on the east the tall island barbarians. All within the four seas were grateful for Emperor Shun's labours.

passages.zh: 於是禹乃興九招之樂，致異物，鳳皇來翔。
passages.en: Yu then performed the nine tunes, and the result was that strange creatures and phoenixes flew to and fro.

passages.zh: 天下明德皆自虞帝始。
passages.en: Men of illustrious virtue in the empire began from the days of Emperor Shun of Yu.

passages.zh: 舜年二十以孝聞，年三十堯舉之，年五十攝行天子事，年五十八堯崩，年六十一代堯踐帝位。
passages.en: When Shun was twenty years of age he was noted for his filial piety, at thirty Yao raised him to office, at fifty he assisted in the administration of Imperial affairs, when he was fifty-eight Yao died, and when he was sixty-one he sat on the Imperial throne in Yao's stead.

passages.zh: 踐帝位三十九年，南巡狩，崩於蒼梧之野。
passages.en: After he had occupied the Imperial throne thirty-nine years, he went on a hunting expedition to the south, and died in the desert of Cangwu.

passages.zh: 葬於江南九疑，是為零陵。
passages.en: He was buried at a place called Lingling in the Jiuyi range in Jiangnan province.

passages.zh: 舜之踐帝位，載天子旗，往朝父瞽叟，夔夔唯謹，如子道。
passages.en: After Shun had come to the throne, and was flying the Imperial flag, he went to pay a visit to his father, Gusou, and addressed him in a grave and respectful manner, as a son should do.

passages.zh: 封弟象為諸侯。
passages.en: He raised his brother Xiang to the rank of prince.

passages.zh: 舜子商均亦不肖，舜乃豫薦禹於天。
passages.en: Shun's son Shangjun was also degenerate, so that Shun, being prepared, recommended Yu to the notice of Heaven.

passages.zh: 十七年而崩。
passages.en: Seventeen years later he died.

passages.zh: 三年喪畢，禹亦乃讓舜子，如舜讓堯子。
passages.en: When the three years' mourning was over, Yu also yielded to Shun's son just as Shun had yielded to Yao's son.

passages.zh: 諸侯歸之，然後禹踐天子位。
passages.en: But the princes gave their allegiance to Yu, and he thereupon came to the Imperial throne.

passages.zh: 堯子丹朱，舜子商均，皆有疆土，以奉先祀。
passages.en: Yao's son Danzhu, and Shun's son Shangjun, both held territory so that they might be enabled to perform sacrifices to their ancestors.

passages.zh: 服其服，禮樂如之。
passages.en: They paid the due observances, such as religious ceremonies and music.

passages.zh: 以客見天子，天子弗臣，示不敢專也。
passages.en: They went to the audiences as the Emperor's guests. The Emperor did not dare, without due notification from his ministers, to act on his own responsibility.

passages.zh: 自黃帝至舜、禹，皆同姓而異其國號，以章明德。
passages.en: From Huangdi to Shun and Yu all the sovereigns had the same surname, but different dynastic appellations, and so displayed their illustrious virtue.

passages.zh: 故黃帝為有熊，帝顓頊為高陽，帝嚳為高辛，帝堯為陶唐，帝舜為有虞。
passages.en: So Huangdi was called Youxiong; Emperor Zhuanxu was Gaoyang; Emperor Ku was Gaoxin; Emperor Yao, Taotang; Emperor Shun was Youyu.

passages.zh: 帝禹為夏后而別氏，姓姒氏。
passages.en: Emperor Yu was Xiahou; and he had also the name Si.

passages.zh: 契為商，姓子氏。
passages.en: Xie had the family name of Shang with the personal name Zi.

passages.zh: 棄為周，姓姬氏。
passages.en: And Qi had the family name Zhou with the personal name Ji.

passages.zh: 太史公曰：學者多稱五帝，尚矣。
passages.en: The historian remarks on this as follows: Most scholars say that the five emperors are deserving of honour.

passages.zh: 然尚書獨載堯以來；而百家言黃帝，其文不雅馴，薦紳先生難言之。
passages.en: But the Book of History only refers to Yao, and those who come after him, while the book of the 'hundred families' speaks of the Yellow emperor. The style of the latter work is not, however, very refined, and the officials and gentry hardly ever refer to it.

passages.zh: 孔子所傳宰予問五帝德及帝系姓，儒者或不傳。
passages.en: Confucius handed down these works, viz. 'Zai Yu's questions,' the 'virtues of the five emperors,' and 'the genealogies and names of the emperors,' but the literati doubt that they have been so handed down.

passages.zh: 余嘗西至空桐，北過涿鹿，東漸於海，南浮江淮矣，至長老皆各往往稱黃帝、堯、舜之處，風教固殊焉，總之不離古文者近是。
passages.en: I have travelled westward as far as 'hollow cave' hill, northward beyond Zhuolu, eastward I have crossed the sea, while southward I have floated on rafts along the Yangtze and Huai rivers, and all the elders whom I met again and again talked of the places where the Yellow emperor, Yao, and Shun dwelt, and how very different their customs and teachings were. In short, those who are attached to the ancient literature must be familiar with their sayings.

passages.zh: 予觀春秋、國語，其發明五帝德、帝系姓章矣，顧弟弗深考，其所表見皆不虛。
passages.en: I have looked at the 'Spring and Autumn' classic, and the 'Narratives of the States,' which make the 'virtues of the five emperors' and the 'genealogies and names of the emperors' very clear. I have inspected these works, but not thoroughly examined them, and the portions I have quoted are none of them unimportant.

passages.zh: 書缺有閒矣，其軼乃時時見於他說。
passages.en: There are defects in the book, and occasionally the views of others may be noted.

passages.zh: 非好學深思，心知其意，固難為淺見寡聞道也。
passages.en: Scholars should not think too deeply over the book, but take the general drift of it, when it can hardly be called superficial.

passages.zh: 余并論次，擇其言尤雅者，故著為本紀書首。
passages.en: There are a few investigations into doctrine, which I have discussed in the concrete, and then selected some of the more elegant sentences for quotation. Thus I have compiled the first chapter of the 'Original Records.'

passages.zh: 夏禹，名曰文命。
passages.en: Yu of Xia was styled Wenming.

passages.zh: 禹之父曰鯀，鯀之父曰帝顓頊，顓頊之父曰昌意，昌意之父曰黃帝。
passages.en: Yu's father was Gun, whose father was the Emperor Zhuanxu, whose father was Changyi, whose father was Huangdi;

passages.zh: 禹者，黃帝之玄孫而帝顓頊之孫也。
passages.en: so Yu was Huangdi's great-great-grandson, and Zhuanxu's grandson.

passages.zh: 禹之曾大父昌意及父鯀皆不得在帝位，為人臣。
passages.en: Yu's great-grandfather Changyi and his father Gun were both unable to sit on the Imperial throne, being simply officials.

passages.zh: 當帝堯之時，鴻水滔天，浩浩懷山襄陵，下民其憂。
passages.en: In the time of the Emperor Yao the deluge assailed the heavens, and in its vast expanse encompassed the mountains, and overtopped the hills, so that the common people were troubled about it.

passages.zh: 堯求能治水者，群臣四嶽皆曰鯀可。
passages.en: Yao sought for one capable of controlling the waters. All the officials and presidents of the four mountains said, 'Gun might do it.'

passages.zh: 堯曰：「鯀為人負命毀族，不可。」
passages.en: Yao said, 'Gun is a man who disobeys orders, and ruins his companions. He will not do.'

passages.zh: 四嶽曰：「等之未有賢於鯀者，願帝試之。」
passages.en: The president of the four mountains said, 'Among his equals there is no one so worthy as Gun; I wish your Majesty would try him.'

passages.zh: 於是堯聽四嶽，用鯀治水。
passages.en: Upon which Yao, giving heed to the president of the four mountains, employed Gun to control the waters

passages.zh: 九年而水不息，功用不成。
passages.en: for nine years, but the waters did not abate, and the work was unaccomplished.

passages.zh: 於是帝堯乃求人，更得舜。
passages.en: Then the Emperor Yao sought a man in his stead, and secured Shun.

passages.zh: 舜登用，攝行天子之政，巡狩。
passages.en: Shun being employed in the public service was associated with the Son of Heaven in the administration. While on a tour of inspection,

passages.zh: 行視鯀之治水無狀，乃殛鯀於羽山以死。
passages.en: he saw that there was no evidence that Gun kept the waters under control, so he imprisoned him for life on Mount Yu,

passages.zh: 天下皆以舜之誅為是。
passages.en: and everyone in the Empire said that Shun's decision was a just one.

passages.zh: 於是舜舉鯀子禹，而使續鯀之業。
passages.en: Shun then appointed Gun's son Yu to the post, and directed him to continue his father's occupation.

passages.zh: 堯崩，帝舜問四嶽曰：「有能成美堯之事者使居官？」
passages.en: After Yao's death, the Emperor Shun asked the presidents of the four mountains, 'is there was any one who can perfect and develop Yao's undertakings, and can be employed in an official capacity?'

passages.zh: 皆曰：「伯禹為司空，可成美堯之功。」
passages.en: They all said, 'There is lord Yu, the Minister of Works; he might perfect and develop Yao's labours.'

passages.zh: 舜曰：「嗟，然！」
passages.en: Shun said, 'Ah yes!

passages.zh: 命禹：「女平水土，維是勉之。」
passages.en: you, Yu, have regulated the water and the land, but in this office you must exert yourself.'

passages.zh: 禹拜稽首，讓於契、后稷、皋陶。
passages.en: Yu did obeisance with his head to the ground, and would have declined in favour of Xie, Prince Millet, or Gaoyao,

passages.zh: 舜曰：「女其往視爾事矣。」
passages.en: but Shun said 'Go and attend to your duties.'

passages.zh: 禹為人敏給克勤；
passages.en: Yu was quick, earnest, and diligent,

passages.zh: 其德不違，其仁可親，其言可信；
passages.en: not deviating from virtue, kind, and lovable; his word could be depended on,

passages.zh: 聲為律，身為度，稱以出；
passages.en: his voice was musical, and his body, like a balance properly adjusted,

passages.zh: 亹亹穆穆，為綱為紀。
passages.en: moved unweariedly and solemnly in accordance with certain fixed rules.

passages.zh: 禹乃遂與益、后稷奉帝命，命諸侯百姓興人徒以傅土，行山表木，定高山大川。
passages.en: Yu, then in company with Yi and Prince Millet, having received the Emperor's orders, bade the princes and people raise a gang of men to make a division of the land, and following the line of the hills hew down the trees, and determine the characteristics of the high hills and great rivers.

passages.zh: 禹傷先人父鯀功之不成受誅，乃勞身焦思，居外十三年，過家門不敢入。
passages.en: Yu was grieved in that his progenitor Gun had been punished on account of his work being incomplete, so, wearied in body and distressed in mind, he lived away from his home for 13 years, passing the door of his house without daring to enter.

passages.zh: 薄衣食，致孝于鬼神。
passages.en: With ragged clothes and poor diet he paid his devotions to the spirits

passages.zh: 卑宮室，致費於溝淢。
passages.en: until his wretched hovel fell in ruins in the ditch.

passages.zh: 陸行乘車，水行乘船，泥行乘橇，山行乘檋。
passages.en: When travelling along the dry land he used a carriage, on the water he used a boat, in miry places a sledge, while in going over the hills he used spikes.

passages.zh: 左準繩，右規矩，載四時，以開九州，通九道，陂九澤，度九山。
passages.en: On the one hand he used the marking-line, and on the other the compass and square. Working as the seasons permitted, and with a view to open up the nine provinces, he made the roads communicable, banked up the marshes, surveyed the hills,

passages.zh: 令益予眾庶稻，可種卑溼。
passages.en: told Yi and his band that paddy should be planted in low damp places,

passages.zh: 命后稷予眾庶難得之食。
passages.en: and directed Lord Millet and his band, when it was difficult to obtain food,

passages.zh: 食少，調有餘相給，以均諸侯。
passages.en: or when food was scarce, to barter their surplus stock in exchange for what they had not, so as to put all the princes on an equal footing.

passages.zh: 禹乃行相地宜所有以貢，及山川之便利。
passages.en: Yu in this way worked for the mutual convenience of the respective districts as regards the distribution of the wealth and resources of the country.

passages.zh: 禹行自冀州始。
passages.en: Yu started from Jizhou.

passages.zh: 冀州：既載壺口，治梁及岐。
passages.en: He commenced his work in Jizhou at Pot's mouth, and regulated the country about the Liang and Qi mountains.

passages.zh: 既修太原，至于嶽陽。
passages.en: Having repaired the works at Taiyuan he went to the south of Mount Yue.

passages.zh: 覃懷致功，至於衡漳。
passages.en: He was successful with his labours at Tanhuai, and went to the cross-flowing stream of Zhang.

passages.zh: 其土白壤。
passages.en: The soil of the province was white clay.

passages.zh: 賦上上錯，田中中，常、衛既從，大陸既為。
passages.en: Its contribution of revenue was the first of the highest class with some admixture of the second, while its fields were the average of the middle class. The Chang and Wei rivers flowed in their proper channels, and the Dalu plain was formed.

passages.zh: 鳥夷皮服。
passages.en: The bird barbarians, wearing skin dresses,

passages.zh: 夾右碣石，入于海。
passages.en: kept close on the right to the granite rocks until they came to the sea.

passages.zh: 濟、河維沇州：九河既道，雷夏既澤，雍、沮會同，桑土既蠶，於是民得下丘居土。
passages.en: The Qi and Yellow rivers formed the boundaries of Yanzhou. The nine branches of the Yellow river followed their courses, and Lei Xia was a marsh, in which the Yong and Ju streams were united. The mulberry region was supplied with silkworms, and then the people came down from the heights and occupied it.

passages.zh: 其土黑墳，草繇木條。
passages.en: The soil of the province was black loam, its herbage luxuriant, and trees tall.

passages.zh: 田中下，賦貞，作十有三年乃同。
passages.en: Its fields were the lowest of the middle class. Its contribution of revenue was fixed at what would just be deemed the correct amount, and after it had been worked for 13 years it was assimilated to the other provinces.

passages.zh: 其貢漆絲，其篚織文。
passages.en: Its tribute consisted of varnish and silk, and woven ornamental fabrics in baskets.

passages.zh: 浮於濟、漯，通於河。
passages.en: You float along the Qi and Ta and so reach the Yellow river.

passages.zh: 海岱維青州：堣夷既略，濰、淄其道。
passages.en: The sea and the Tai mountain formed the boundaries of Qingzhou. The territory of Yuyi was defined, and the Wei and Zi rivers flowed in their proper channels.

passages.zh: 其土白墳，海濱廣潟，厥田斥鹵。
passages.en: The soil of the province was white loam, and on the sea-coast were wide tracts of salt land. Its fields, which were impregnated with salt,

passages.zh: 田上下，賦中上。
passages.en: were the lowest of the first class, and its contribution of revenue the highest of the second.

passages.zh: 厥貢鹽絺，海物維錯，岱畎絲、枲、鉛、松、怪石，萊夷為牧，其篚酓絲。
passages.en: Its tribute consisted of salt, fine cloth of dolichos fibre, and productions of the sea of various kinds, with silk, hemp, lead, pine-trees, and strange stones from the valleys of the Tai. The wild tribes of Lai were shepherds, and brought in their baskets silk from the mountain mulberry.

passages.zh: 浮於汶，通於濟。
passages.en: You float down the Wen, and so reach the Qi.

passages.zh: 海岱及淮維徐州：淮、沂其治，蒙、羽其藝。
passages.en: The sea, the Tai mountain, and the river Huai formed the boundaries of Xuzhou. The Huai and Yi rivers were regulated. The Meng and Yu mountains were made fit for cultivation.

passages.zh: 大野既都，東原底平。
passages.en: The waters of Daye formed a marsh, and the eastern plain became level.

passages.zh: 其土赤埴墳，草木漸包。
passages.en: The soil of this province was red, clayey, and rich. The grass and trees grew more and more bushy.

passages.zh: 其田上中，賦中中。
passages.en: Its fields were the second of the highest class, and its contribution of revenue was the average of the second.

passages.zh: 貢維土五色，羽畎夏狄，嶧陽孤桐，泗濱浮磬，淮夷蠙珠臮魚，其篚玄纖縞。
passages.en: Its tribute consisted of earth of different colours, the variegated pheasants from the valleys of mount Yu, the solitary dryandra from the south of mount Yi, and the floating musical stones from the banks of the Si. The wild tribes of the Huai brought oyster-pearls and fish, and their baskets were full of dark embroideries and pure white silken fabrics.

passages.zh: 浮于淮、泗，通于河。
passages.en: You float along the Huai and Si and so reach the Yellow river.

passages.zh: 淮海維揚州：彭蠡既都，陽鳥所居。
passages.en: The Huai river and the sea formed the boundaries of Yangzhou. The Pengli lake formed a reservoir of water, where the sun birds (i.e. the wild geese) settled.

passages.zh: 三江既入，震澤致定。
passages.en: The three large rivers entered the sea, and the shaking marsh became quite still.

passages.zh: 竹箭既布。
passages.en: Bamboos of different kinds were spread about,

passages.zh: 其草惟夭，其木惟喬，其土涂泥。
passages.en: the grass grew luxuriantly, and the trees tall, but the soil was miry.

passages.zh: 田下下，賦下上上雜。
passages.en: The fields of this province were the lowest of the lowest class; its contribution of revenue was the highest of the lowest class, with a proportion of the class above.

passages.zh: 貢金三品，瑤、琨、竹箭，齒、革、羽、旄，島夷卉服，其篚織貝，其包橘、柚錫貢。
passages.en: Its tribute consisted of gold, silver, and copper, jasper, pearls, bamboos of various kinds, ivory, hides, feathers, and hair. The wild people of the isles brought garments of grass; their baskets were filled with woven silks and cowries, and their bundles contained small oranges and pummeloes, which were rendered when required.

passages.zh: 均江海，通淮、泗。
passages.en: You follow the course of the Great river and the sea, and so reach the Huai and Si rivers.

passages.zh: 荊及衡陽維荊州：江、漢朝宗于海。
passages.en: Mount Jing and the south of Mount Heng formed the boundaries of Jingzhou. The Great river and Han rivers paid their court to the sea.

passages.zh: 九江甚中，沱、涔已道，云土、夢為治。
passages.en: The nine rivers occupied all the middle of the land. The Tuo and Qian rivers flowed in their proper channels; and the land in the Yun and Meng marshes was made capable of cultivation.

passages.zh: 其土涂泥。
passages.en: The soil of this province was miry;

passages.zh: 田下中，賦上下。
passages.en: its fields were the average of the lowest class; its contribution of revenue was the lowest of the highest class.

passages.zh: 貢羽、旄、齒、革，金三品，杶、榦、栝、柏，礪、砥、砮、丹，維箘簬、楛，三國致貢其名，包匭菁茅，其篚玄纁璣組，九江入賜大龜。
passages.en: Its tribute consisted of feathers, hair, ivory, hides, gold, silver, copper, woods of the wild varnish, cudrania, triloba, juniper, and cypress trees, with grindstones, whetstones, stone arrowheads, and cinnabar, likewise the Jun and Lu bamboos, and the wood of the redthorn, of which the three states brought the most noted specimens. The three ribbed rush was put in cases which were wrapped up, while the baskets were filled with dark and purple silks and strings of coarse pearls. From the country of the nine rivers the great tortoise was presented.

passages.zh: 浮于江、沱、涔、（于）漢，踰于雒，至于南河。
passages.en: You float down the Great river, the Tuo, the Qian, and the Han rivers, cross over to the Luo, whence you reach the southern part of the Yellow river.

passages.zh: 荊河惟豫州：伊、雒、瀍、澗既入于河，滎播既都，道荷澤，被明都。
passages.en: The Jing mountain and the Yellow river formed the boundaries of Yuzhou. The Yi, the Luo the Chan, and the Jian streams flowed into the Yellow river, the Yingbo waters formed a lake, and the waters of the Ke marsh were conducted to the Ming reservoir.

passages.zh: 其土壤，下土墳壚。
passages.en: The soil of this province was clayey, while in its lower parts it was rich, and in clods.

passages.zh: 田中上，賦雜上中。
passages.en: Its fields were the highest of the middle class; its contribution of revenue was the average of the highest class, with a proportion of the very highest.

passages.zh: 貢漆、絲、絺、紵，其篚纖絮，錫貢磬錯。
passages.en: The tribute was varnish, silk, fine cloth of dolichos fibre, and sackcloth. The baskets were filled with delicate embroidery and floss-silk, and stones for polishing musical stones were rendered when required.

passages.zh: 浮於雒，達於河。
passages.en: You float along the Luo until you reach the Yellow river.

passages.zh: 華陽黑水惟梁州：汶、嶓既藝，沱、涔既道，蔡、蒙旅平，和夷厎績。
passages.en: The south of Mount Hua and the Blackwater formed the boundaries of Liangzhou. The Min and Bo hills were cultivated. The Tuo and Qian rivers flowed in their channels, sacrifices were offered to the hills Cai and Meng on the plateaux, and the wild tribes on the He river were successfully managed.

passages.zh: 其土青驪。
passages.en: The soil of the province was bluish black.

passages.zh: 田下上，賦下中三錯。
passages.en: Its fields were the highest of the lowest class; its contribution of revenue was the average of the lowest class, with proportions of the rates above and below.

passages.zh: 貢璆、鐵、銀、鏤、砮、磬，熊、羆、狐、貍、織皮。
passages.en: Its tribute consisted of the best gold, iron, silver, steel, stone arrow-heads, musical stones, and nets woven from the hair of bears and foxes.

passages.zh: 西傾因桓是來，浮于潛，踰于沔，入于渭，亂于河。
passages.en: From Xiqing you come along the river Huan, float down the Qian, cross over to the Mian, enter the Wei, and ferry across the Yellow river.

passages.zh: 黑水西河惟雍州：弱水既西，涇屬渭汭。
passages.en: The Blackwater and the western bend of the Yellow river formed the boundaries of Yongzhou. The Ruo water flowed westward; the Qing,

passages.zh: 漆、沮既從，灃水所同。
passages.en: the Qi, and Ju streams formed a junction with the Wei, as also did the waters of the Feng.

passages.zh: 荊、岐已旅，終南、敦物至于鳥鼠。
passages.en: The Jing and Qi hills were sacrificed too, and so were those of Zhongnan and Dunwu all the way to 'Bird-and-Rat' hill.

passages.zh: 原隰厎績，至于都野。
passages.en: Successful measures were taken with the plains and swamps as far as the Duye marsh.

passages.zh: 三危既度，三苗大序。
passages.en: The people of Sanwei were controlled, and the Sanmiao tribes kept in good order.

passages.zh: 其土黃壤。
passages.en: The soil of the province was yellow clay.

passages.zh: 田上上，賦中下。
passages.en: Its fields were the highest of the highest class, while its contribution of revenue was the lowest of the second.

passages.zh: 貢璆、琳、瑯玕。
passages.en: Its tribute was jade, topazes, and white cornelian stones.

passages.zh: 浮于積石，至于龍門西河，會于渭汭。
passages.en: From 'Stonepile' hill you float on to 'Dragongate' on the western branch of the Yellow river at its junction with the Wei river.

passages.zh: 織皮昆侖、析支、渠搜，西戎即序。
passages.en: The western Jung tribes from the Gunlun, Hsichih, and Ch'üsou mountains with their hair-cloth and furs were kept in order.

passages.zh: 道九山：汧及岐至于荊山，踰于河；
passages.en: Journeying over the nine mountains, you go from Qian and Qi hills to mount Jing; passing the Yellow river,

passages.zh: 壺口、雷首至于太嶽；
passages.en: Pot's mouth, and Leishou you come to Taiyue;

passages.zh: 砥柱、析城至于王屋；
passages.en: from Dizhu and Xicheng hills to 'King's house';

passages.zh: 太行、常山至于碣石，入于海；
passages.en: from Taihang and Mount Chang to the granite rocks and the sea;

passages.zh: 西傾、朱圉、鳥鼠至于太華；
passages.en: from Xiqing, Zhuyu, and 'Bird-and-Rat' hills to mount Taihua;

passages.zh: 熊耳、外方、桐柏至于負尾；
passages.en: from 'Bear's-ear,' Waifang, and Tongbo hills to Fuwei;

passages.zh: 道嶓冢，至于荊山；
passages.en: you journey from Bozhong to mount Jing;

passages.zh: 內方至于大別；
passages.en: from Neifang to Dabie,

passages.zh: 汶山之陽至衡山，過九江，至于敷淺原。
passages.en: and from the south of Mount Min to Mount Heng, and cross the nine rivers to the Fuqian plain.

passages.zh: 道九川：弱水至於合黎，餘波入于流沙。
passages.en: Following the course of the nine large rivers: from the Ruo river you go to Heli, whence the superfluous water flows into the Rolling sands.

passages.zh: 道黑水，至于三危，入于南海。
passages.en: You trace the Blackwater to Sanwei, where it enters the southern sea;

passages.zh: 道河積石，至于龍門，南至華陰，東至砥柱，又東至于盟津，東過雒汭，至于大邳，北過降水，至于大陸，北播為九河，同為逆河，入于海。
passages.en: you trace the Yellow river from 'Stone-pile' to 'Dragongate,' southward to the north of Mount Hua, eastward to Dizhu, again eastward to the ford Meng, eastward you pass the junction of the Luo river to Dapei, northward past the Jiang water to Dalu, northward the stream is divided and becomes the nine rivers, reunited it forms the opposing river and flows into the sea.

passages.zh: 嶓冢道瀁，東流為漢，又東為蒼浪之水，過三澨，入于大別，南入于江，東匯澤為彭蠡，東為北江，入于海。
passages.en: From Bozhong you trace the course of the Yang. Flowing eastward it becomes the Han, further east it becomes the Canglang water, passing the three dykes it goes to Dabie, southward it enters the great river, eastward whirling on it forms the Pengli marsh, again eastward it forms the northern great river and enters the sea.

passages.zh: 汶山道江，東別為沱，又東至于醴，過九江，至于東陵，東迆北會于匯，東為中江，入于梅。
passages.en: From mount Min you trace the great river, which branching to the east becomes the Tuo, again eastward it comes to the Li, passes the nine great rivers and comes to the eastern ridge, flows eastward, winds to the north, and joins the eddies, eastward it becomes the middle great river and enters the sea.

passages.zh: 道沇水，東為濟，入于河，泆為滎，東出陶丘北，又東至于荷，又東北會于汶，又東北入于海。
passages.en: Tracing the course of the Yan river—it flows to the east, becomes the Qi, enters the Yellow river, flows on and becomes the Ying; eastward it comes out to the north of Taoqiu, further east flows into the Ke marsh, again north-eastward it unites with the Wen, and still further to the north-east it enters the sea.

passages.zh: 道淮自桐柏，東會于泗、沂，東入于海。
passages.en: Tracing the course of the Huai from Tongbo, to the eastward it unites with the Si and Yi rivers, and flowing to the east enters the sea.

passages.zh: 道渭自鳥鼠同穴，東會于灃，又東北至于涇，東過漆、沮，入于河。
passages.en: Tracing the course of the Wei from 'Bird-and-rat-in-the-same-hole' hill—it unites to the east with the Feng, further to the north-east it flows into the Jing, to the east passing the Qi and Ju streams it enters the Yellow river.

passages.zh: 道雒自熊耳，東北會于澗、瀍，又東會于伊，東北入于河。
passages.en: Tracing the course of the Luo from 'Bear's-ear' hill, on the north-east it unites with the Jian and Chan, further to the east it unites with the Yi, and to the north-east enters the Yellow river.

passages.zh: 於是九州攸同，四奧既居，九山刊旅，九川滌原，九澤既陂，四海會同。
passages.en: So throughout the nine provinces a similar order was effected: the four coasts were built over, the hills were cleared of their wood and sacrificed to, the streams had their sources scoured out, the marshes were well banked, and all within the four seas had access to the capital.

passages.zh: 六府甚修，眾土交正，致慎財賦，咸則三壤成賦。
passages.en: The six treasuries of nature were made the most of, and the various parts of the country exactly compared so that the receipt of revenue could be carefully adjusted according to their resources. The three characters of the soil were classified, and the taxation fixed.

passages.zh: 中國賜土姓：「祗臺德先，不距朕行。」
passages.en: The central government conferred lands and surnames. Revenue was paid to the Emperor's exalted virtue, which was set up as an example, and none opposed his Majesty's action.

passages.zh: 令天子之國以外五百里甸服：百里賦納總，二百里納銍，三百里納秸服，四百里粟，五百里米。
passages.en: Now beyond the Emperor's capital 500 li constituted the Imperial domain. From the first hundred li they brought, as revenue, the whole plant of the grain, from the second the ears, from the third the straw, but the people had to perform feudal services, from the fourth the grain in the husk, and from the fifth the grain cleaned.

passages.zh: 甸服外五百里侯服：百里采，二百里任國，三百里諸侯。
passages.en: Five hundred li beyond the Imperial domain constituted the domain of the nobles. The first hundred li formed the allotments to the feudal nobles, the second hundred those to the people employed by the State, and the other 300 those to the various princes.

passages.zh: 侯服外五百里綏服：三百里揆文教，二百里奮武衛。
passages.en: Five hundred li beyond the nobles' domain lay the peaceful domain. In the first 300 li they cultivated learning and the moral duties, and in the other 200 their energies lay in the direction of war and defence.

passages.zh: 綏服外五百里要服：三百里夷，二百里蔡。
passages.en: Five hundred li beyond the peaceful domain was the domain of restraint. The first 300 were occupied by the Yi tribes, and the other 200 by criminals undergoing the lesser banishment.

passages.zh: 要服外五百里荒服：三百里蠻，二百里流。
passages.en: Five hundred li beyond the domain of restraint lay the wild domain. Three hundred li were occupied by the Man tribes, and the other 200 li by criminals undergoing the greater banishment.

passages.zh: 東漸于海，西被于流沙，朔、南暨：聲教訖于四海。
passages.en: On the east reaching to the sea, on the west extending to the rolling sands, to the utmost limits of the north and south, Yu's fame and influence spread everywhere within the four seas,

passages.zh: 於是帝錫禹玄圭，以告成功于天下。
passages.en: so the Emperor presented him with a dark-coloured sceptre, thus announcing to the empire the completion of his work.

passages.zh: 天下於是太平治。
passages.en: The empire was at peace and well governed.

passages.zh: 皋陶作士以理民。
passages.en: Gaoyao was made chief minister of state with a view to his ruling the people.

passages.zh: 帝舜朝，禹、伯夷、皋陶相與語帝前。
passages.en: The emperor Shun gave audience to Yu, Poyi, and Gaoyao, who addressed each other before the Emperor.

passages.zh: 皋陶述其謀曰：「信其道德，謀明輔和。」
passages.en: Gaoyao, setting forth his counsels, said, 'If a man sincerely follows the path of duty and virtue, his counsellors will be intelligent, and those who aid him will act in harmony.'

passages.zh: 禹曰：「然，如何？」
passages.en: Yu said, 'Yes, but what do you mean?'

passages.zh: 皋陶曰：「於！慎其身修，思長，敦序九族，眾明高翼，近可遠在已。」
passages.en: Gaoyao said, 'Oh! he will be careful about his personal cultivation, and will think constantly about it. Thus he will pay due regard to precedence among the nine branches of his kindred, all the intelligent will exert themselves in his service, and so from what is at hand he may attain to what is far off.'

passages.zh: 禹拜美言，曰：「然。」
passages.en: Yu made obeisance at these excellent words, and said, 'It is so.'

passages.zh: 皋陶曰：「於！在知人，在安民。」
passages.en: Gaoyao said 'Oh! It all lies in knowing mankind, and in quieting the people.'

passages.zh: 禹曰：「吁！皆若是，惟帝其難之。
passages.en: Yu said, 'Alas! to attain to all this would be difficult even for the Emperor.

passages.zh: 知人則智，能官人；
passages.en: He who knows men is wise; he who can put men into the posts for which they are fit,

passages.zh: 能安民則惠，黎民懷之。
passages.en: and can quiet the people, is benevolent, and the black-haired race will cherish him in their hearts.

passages.zh: 能知能惠，何憂乎驩兜，何遷乎有苗，何畏乎巧言善色佞人？」
passages.en: When a man can be thus wise and kind, why should he have anxiety about a Huandou? why to be removing a chief of the Miao tribes? why should he fear a man of specious words, good appearance, and artful ways?'

passages.zh: 皋陶曰：「然，於！亦行有九德，亦言其有德。」
passages.en: Gaoyao said, 'Just so! there are in all nine virtues, and when we say that a man possesses these virtues it is as much as to say that he begins to do such and such things.

passages.zh: 乃言曰：「始事事，寬而栗，柔而立，願而共，治而敬，擾而毅，直而溫，簡而廉，剛而實，彊而義，章其有常，吉哉。
passages.en: They are liberality combined with dignity, mildness combined with firmness, bluntness combined with respect, aptness for government combined with caution, docility combined with boldness, straightforwardness combined with gentleness, easy negligence combined with discrimination, resolution combined with sincerity, and courage combined with justice. If these are apparent, and that continuously, how fortunate it will be.

passages.zh: 日宣三德，蚤夜翊明有家。
passages.en: He who daily displays three of these virtues could early and late support and educate a family.

passages.zh: 日嚴振敬六德，亮采有國。
passages.en: He who is strict and reverent in cultivating six of these virtues could brilliantly conduct the affairs of the State.

passages.zh: 翕受普施，九德咸事，俊乂在官，百吏肅謹。
passages.en: When such men are received and found everywhere, the possessors of those nine virtues will all be employed, and men of eminence will hold office, and the various officers will be respectful and diligent,

passages.zh: 毋教邪淫奇謀。
passages.en: not teaching heretical, vicious, or strange doctrines.

passages.zh: 非其人居其官，是謂亂天事。
passages.en: If such men and such officers do not exist it may be said that the affairs of Heaven are in confusion.

passages.zh: 天討有罪，五刑五用哉。
passages.en: Heaven punishes the guilty, and the five punishments can be severally applied for that purpose.

passages.zh: 吾言厎可行乎？」
passages.en: Are my words sound, and can they be put in force?'

passages.zh: 禹曰：「女言致可績行。」
passages.en: Yu said, 'Your words are perfect, and can be successfully put in force.'

passages.zh: 皋陶曰：「余未有知，思贊道哉。」
passages.en: Gaoyao said, 'As to that I do not know, but I aim at assisting in the path of duty.'

passages.zh: 帝舜謂禹曰：「女亦昌言。」
passages.en: The Emperor Shun said to Yu, 'Will you, too, make a brilliant speech?'

passages.zh: 禹拜曰；「於，予何言！予思日孳孳。」
passages.en: Yu did obeisance and said, 'Ah! what can I say? I aim at being assiduous from day to day.'

passages.zh: 皋陶難禹曰：「何謂孳孳？」
passages.en: Gaoyao, teasing Yu, said, 'What do you mean by being assiduous?'

passages.zh: 禹曰：「鴻水滔天，浩浩懷山襄陵，下民皆服於水。
passages.en: Yu said, 'When the flood assailed the heavens, and in its vast expanse encompassed the mountains and overtopped the hills, so that the common people were overcome by the water,

passages.zh: 予陸行乘車，水行乘舟，泥行乘橇，山行乘檋，行山刊木。
passages.en: I travelled on dry land in a carriage, went about on the water in a boat, in miry places I used a sledge, while in going over the hills I used spikes. All along the hills I hewed paths through the woods,

passages.zh: 與益予眾庶稻鮮食。
passages.en: and together with Yi supplied the people with paddy and fresh meat.

passages.zh: 以決九川致四海，浚畎澮致之川。
passages.en: In order to drain the nine streams into the four seas, I deepened the channels and canals, and connected them with the rivers,

passages.zh: 與稷予眾庶難得之食。
passages.en: and together with 'Millet' and the people in general when it was difficult to obtain food,

passages.zh: 食少，調有餘補不足，徙居。
passages.en: and when food was scarce I bartered the surplus stock to make up for deficiencies, and removed the stores.

passages.zh: 眾民乃定，萬國為治。」
passages.en: Thus the people were quieted, and the various states properly governed.'

passages.zh: 皋陶曰：「然，此而美也。」
passages.en: Gaoyao said, 'Yes! this was good on your part.'

passages.zh: 禹曰：「於，帝！慎乃在位，安爾止。
passages.en: Yu said, 'Ah! your Majesty, carefully maintain the Throne which you occupy, and be quiet in your behaviour,

passages.zh: 輔德，天下大應。
passages.en: assist virtue, and the nation will grandly respond to your pure desires.

passages.zh: 清意以昭待上帝命，天其重命用休。」
passages.en: It will thus be manifest that you await the decrees of the Supreme Being, and will not Heaven renew its favouring appointment by conferring blessings on you?'

passages.zh: 帝曰：「吁，臣哉，臣哉！臣作朕股肱耳目。
passages.en: The Emperor said, 'Dear me! ministers! ministers! you constitute my legs and arms, my ears and eyes.

passages.zh: 予欲左右有民，女輔之。
passages.en: If I wish to aid and support the people, you help me to do so.

passages.zh: 余欲觀古人之象。日月星辰，作文繡服色，女明之。
passages.en: If I wish to see the emblematic figures of the ancients — the sun, moon, and stars — which are embroidered on the robes and coloured silks, you see them clearly for me.

passages.zh: 予欲聞六律五聲八音，來始滑，以出入五言，女聽。
passages.en: If I wish to hear the six pitchpipes, the five notes, and the eight musical instruments on the adjustment of which depend good government or misrule, and the consequent rise or decline of the five duties, you hear them for me.

passages.zh: 予即辟，女匡拂予。女無面諛。退而謗予。
passages.en: If I do wrong, you have to correct me. Do not flatter me to my face and speak evil of me behind my back.

passages.zh: 敬四輔臣。諸眾讒嬖臣，君德誠施皆清矣。」
passages.en: Be reverent, ye four ministers, and all ye calumniating minions of officials. If the prince's virtue is honestly displayed all men will be pure.'

passages.zh: 禹曰：「然。帝即不時，布同善惡則毋功。」
passages.en: Yu said, 'Yes! should your Majesty not act thus, but equally employ the good and bad, you will gain no credit.'

passages.zh: 帝曰：「毋若丹朱傲，維慢游是好，毋水行舟，朋淫于家，用絕其世。予不能順是。」
passages.en: The Emperor said, 'Do not be arrogant like Zhu of Dan, who took his pleasure only in idleness and dissipation. He would make boats go where there was no water, introduced licentious friends into his family, and thereby cut off the hereditary honours of his house. I could not follow that line of conduct.'

passages.zh: 禹曰：「予（辛壬）娶涂山，［辛壬］癸甲，生啟予不子，以故能成水土功。
passages.en: Yu said, 'I was married at Tushan on the days xin and ren, and on the days gui and jia my son Qi was born. I did not treat him as a son, and therefore was able to complete my labours on the water and on land.

passages.zh: 輔成五服，至于五千里，州十二師，外薄四海，咸建五長，各道有功。
passages.en: I assisted, in completing the five Tenures, extending over 5000 li. In the provinces I appointed twelve tutors, and in the regions beyond to the four seas I established five presidents. These all did their duty, and achieved great results,

passages.zh: 苗頑不即功，帝其念哉。」
passages.en: but the Miao tribes were obstinate, and refused to do their work. Think of this, your Majesty.'

passages.zh: 帝曰：「道吾德，乃女功序之也。」
passages.en: The Emperor said, 'That my virtue is the guide is the result of your orderly arrangements.'

passages.zh: 皋陶於是敬禹之德，令民皆則禹。
passages.en: Gaoyao therefore, respecting Yu's virtues, bade the people carry out as a rule his plan of preferring admonition,

passages.zh: 不如言，刑從之。
passages.en: but also made use of punishments.

passages.zh: 舜德大明。
passages.en: Shun's virtues were very clear.

passages.zh: 於是夔行樂，祖考至，群后相讓，鳥獸翔舞，簫韶九成，鳳皇來儀，百獸率舞，百官信諧。
passages.en: Kui played some music; the spirits of Imperial ancestors, and hosts of nobles gave place to one another, and even birds and beasts wheeled about and danced. When the nine airs of Shun's music were played, the phoenixes came and put themselves in attitudes, the different beasts led each other on to dance, and the various officials were really in harmony.

passages.zh: 帝用此作歌曰：「陟天之命，維時維幾。」
passages.en: The Emperor upon this composed the following ode, 'Being set on high by the favouring appointment of Heaven, we must be careful at every moment, and in every particular.'

passages.zh: 乃歌曰：「股肱喜哉，元首起哉，百工熙哉！」
passages.en: He then sang as follows, 'When the members are happy, the head is exalted, and the various kinds of work are happily performed.'

passages.zh: 皋陶拜手稽首揚言曰：「念哉，率為興事，慎乃憲，敬哉！」
passages.en: Gaoyao did obeisance with his head to his hands, and then to the ground, and with a loud voice said, 'Oh! think. It is yours to lead on and originate affairs. Pay careful attention to your laws. Be cautious.'

passages.zh: 乃更為歌曰：「元首明哉，股肱良哉，庶事康哉！」
passages.en: He continued his song, saying, 'When the head is intelligent, the members are good, and all business will prosper.'

passages.zh: （舜）又歌曰：「元首叢脞哉，股肱惰哉，萬事墮哉！」
passages.en: Shun again sang as follows, 'When the head is vexatious, the members are idle, and all business is ruined.'

passages.zh: 帝拜曰：「然，往欽哉！」
passages.en: The Emperor bowed and said, 'Yes, go and be reverent!'

passages.zh: 於是天下皆宗禹之明度數聲樂，為山川神主。
passages.en: The whole nation upon this applauded Yu's brilliant musical performance, and the divine lord of hills and streams.

passages.zh: 帝舜薦禹於天，為嗣。
passages.en: The Emperor Shun presented Yu to Heaven as his heir,

passages.zh: 十七年而帝舜崩。
passages.en: and 17 years afterwards the Emperor Shun died.

passages.zh: 三年喪畢，禹辭辟舜之子商均於陽城。
passages.en: The three years' mourning being over, Yu retired before Shun's son Shangjun to the town of Yang,

passages.zh: 天下諸侯皆去商均而朝禹。
passages.en: but the princes of the empire all left Shangjun, and went to Yu's court,

passages.zh: 禹於是遂即天子位，南面朝天下，國號曰夏后，姓姒氏。
passages.en: and Yu accordingly occupied the Imperial throne. Facing the south he gave audience to the nation. His dynastic appellation was (Xia hou) Prince of Xia, and his surname Si.

passages.zh: 帝禹立而舉皋陶薦之，且授政焉，而皋陶卒。
passages.en: The Emperor Yu sat on the throne and recommended Gaoyao for promotion, transferring also the administration of affairs to him, but Gaoyao died,

passages.zh: 封皋陶之後於英、六，或在許。
passages.en: and his descendants were enfeoffed with the principalities of Yingliu and Xu.

passages.zh: 而后舉益，任之政。
passages.en: The prince then recommended Yi for the appointment of administrator of affairs.

passages.zh: 十年，帝禹東巡狩，至于會稽而崩。
passages.en: Ten years elapsed, when the Emperor Yu, having gone to the east on a tour of inspection, died at Guiji,

passages.zh: 以天下授益。
passages.en: and the rule of the empire was given to Yi.

passages.zh: 三年之喪畢，益讓帝禹之子啟，而辟居箕山之陽。
passages.en: When the three years' mourning was over, Yi resigned in favour of Yu's son Qi, and retired to the south of Mount Ji.

passages.zh: 禹子啟賢，天下屬意焉。
passages.en: Yu's son Qi was worthy, and the nation fixed its desires upon him,

passages.zh: 及禹崩，雖授益，益之佐禹日淺，天下未洽。
passages.en: but when Yu died, although the rule was given to Yi, he supported Yu but a few days, when the nation not being content

passages.zh: 故諸侯皆去益而朝啟，曰：「吾君帝禹之子也」。
passages.en: the princes all left Yi, and went to Qi's court saying, 'He is the son of our sovereign' emperor Yu.

passages.zh: 於是啟遂即天子之位，是為夏后帝啟。
passages.en: Qi then succeeded to the Imperial throne, and became Emperor Qi, the Prince of Xia.

passages.zh: 夏后帝啟，禹之子，其母涂山氏之女也。
passages.en: The Prince of Xia, Emperor Qi, was the son of Yu, his mother being the daughter of the lord of Tushan.

passages.zh: 有扈氏不服，啟伐之，大戰於甘。
passages.en: As the lord of Hu would not submit, Qi attacked him, and there was a great battle at Han.

passages.zh: 將戰，作甘誓，乃召六卿申之。
passages.en: Just before the engagement the speech at Gan was delivered to the six generals, who were summoned together;

passages.zh: 啟曰：「嗟！六事之人，予誓告女：有扈氏威侮五行，怠棄三正，天用勦絕其命。
passages.en: Qi said, 'Ah! ye who are engaged in my six armies, I have a solemn announcement to make to you. The chief of Hu violently sets at naught the five human relations, and idly casts aside the three obligations of duty. Heaven will on this account oppose him and cut off the span of his life,

passages.zh: 今予維共行天之罰。
passages.en: and I am now but reverently executing the punishment appointed by Heaven.

passages.zh: 左不攻于左，右不攻于右，女不共命。
passages.en: If you on the left do not do your work on the left, and you on the right do not do your work on the right, it will be a disregard of my orders.

passages.zh: 御非其馬之政，女不共命。
passages.en: If you, charioteers, do not observe the rules for the management of your horses, it will be a disregard of my orders.

passages.zh: 用命，賞于祖；不用命，僇于社，予則帑僇女。」
passages.en: You who obey my orders shall be rewarded in the ancestral temple, but you who disobey my orders shall be slain before the altar of the spirits of the land, and I will destroy both you and your children.

passages.zh: 遂滅有扈氏。
passages.en: He thereupon destroyed the chief of Hu,

passages.zh: 天下咸朝。
passages.en: and the whole nation went to the court of the Prince of Xia.

passages.zh: 夏后帝啟崩，子帝太康立。
passages.en: Emperor Qi died, and his son Emperor Taikang (Kang the first) came to the throne.

passages.zh: 帝太康失國，昆弟五人，須于洛汭，作五子之歌。
passages.en: The Emperor Taikang lost his kingdom; his five brothers waited for him on the north of the Luo river, and composed the song of the five sons.

passages.zh: 太康崩，弟中康立，是為帝中康。
passages.en: Kang the first died, and his brother Kang the second came to the throne, that is the Emperor Kang the second.

passages.zh: 帝中康時，羲、和湎淫，廢時亂日。
passages.en: In the time of the Emperor Kang the second, Xi and He, indulging in wine and dissipation, neglected the seasons, and let the calendar get into confusion.

passages.zh: 胤往征之，作胤征。
passages.en: Yin went to punish them, and the 'punitive expedition of Yin' was composed.

passages.zh: 中康崩，子帝相立。
passages.en: Kang the second died, and his son Emperor Xiang came to the throne.

passages.zh: 帝相崩，子帝少康立。
